channel.title: I don't get the whole portforward thing it doesn't work for me :\
channel.description:
Uhm, so its like this I'm following a pretty good rsps tut then when it comes to the part when they tell you to get utorrent and to type in the port thing (43594) and they say there should be 2 ticks but for me its only one and it says it failed the "speed" test or whatever that is and then when I open my client then I put in the port (43594) and the ip from hamachi and it says error connecting so I try the ip 127.0.0.1 because they say if you put that it won't be online so it's only you playing so i went and did that then the same thing happened, always errors D:.
any clue on what happening?? :confused: :confused: :confused: :(

item.title: I don't get the whole portforward thing it doesn't work for me :\
item.dc:creator: @Pro4Show Pro4Show
item.source: I don't get the whole portforward thing it doesn't work for me :\

item.title: I don't get the whole portforward thing it doesn't work for me :\
item.dc:creator: @E_A_Z_E_E E_A_Z_E_E
item.description:
@E_A_Z_E_E wrote:

[quote=“NotLikingThis, post:2, topic:421662”]Portforward from your router cause i’m not sure what utorrent does for portforwarding.
Type “192.168.1.1” in your browser and it should take you to your routers page.
Then sign in.
Username: Admin
Password: Usually admin or check your router for the pass.
Find your portforwarding section and add 43594 to it.(Both TCP and UDP)[/quote]

in video tuts they say to go onto utorrent and go to preference or something and type inside the port: 43594 then run tests or something i don’t know if thats portforwarding im pretty newb :\ but could you explain what portforwarding is? i don’t really get what it’s for D:

Read full topic
item.source: I don't get the whole portforward thing it doesn't work for me :\

item.title: I don't get the whole portforward thing it doesn't work for me :\
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

Portforward from your router cause i’m not sure what utorrent does for portforwarding.
Type “192.168.1.1” in your browser and it should take you to your routers page.
Then sign in.
Username: Admin
Password: Usually admin or check your router for the pass.
Find your portforwarding section and add 43594 to it.(Both TCP and UDP)

Read full topic

any clue on what happening??
